titleStmt.title: The peoples need of a living pastor: asserted and explained in a sermon, preached Novemb. 4. 1656. At the sad and solemn funerals of that late, learned, pious and eminently hopeful minister of the gospel, Mr. John Frost, batchelor in divinity, late fellow of St. Johns Colledge in Cambridge, and pastor of St. Olaves Hart-steeet [sic], London. Together with a narrative of his life and death. By Z. C. minister of the Word at Botolph-Aldgate, London.
titleStmt.author: Crofton, Zachary, 1625 or 6-1672.

titleStmt.title: The peoples need of a living pastor: asserted and explained in a sermon, preached Novemb. 4. 1656. At the sad and solemn funerals of that late, learned, pious and eminently hopeful minister of the gospel, Mr. John Frost, batchelor in divinity, late fellow of St. Johns Colledge in Cambridge, and pastor of St. Olaves Hart-steeet [sic], London. Together with a narrative of his life and death. By Z. C. minister of the Word at Botolph-Aldgate, London.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by E. Cotes, for Thomas Parkhurst at the Three Crowns over against the great conduit at the lower end of Cheapside,

notesStmt.note: Annotation on Thomason copy: "Zach. Crofton" above 'Z.C.'; "Aprill 9".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
